As technology evolves, so do the tactics of scammers. In 2023, over $1.2 trillion was lost to scams, signaling a critical need for heightened awareness. Read More ScamAdviser in Your Browser Never get scammed (again) with the power of ScamAdviser in your browser with our free extension that informs you in real time whether a website is likely to be legitimate or a scam. The browser add-on is available for Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge, and you can install it on as many devices as you want including those of your family and friends to ensure that everyone is protected. Click the link below to download the free ScamAdviser Browser Extension. Download Now Full review Company Rating We see that the owner of the website is using a service to hide his/her identity. This may be because the owner does not want to get spammed. However, it also makes it difficult to identify the real owner of the website. As a result, websites hiding their identity get a slightly lower score. Webshop Analysis According to Tranco this site has a low Tranco rank. This means that the number of visitors to this website is quite low. You can expect this from a small, starting or niche website. A popular website however should have a higher ranking. How to recognize a scam Technical Analysis A valid SSL certificate was found. Professional companies use an SSL certificate to encrypt communication between your computer and their website. However, there are different levels of certification and scammers also install a free SSL certificate. If you have to enter your data, never do this without checking if an SSL certificate protects your information. Don't Be Fooled - Spotting Fake Celebrity Endorsements read more Popular Stories How to Recognize a Scam Website As the influence of the internet rises, so does the prevalence of online scams. There are fraudsters making all kinds of claims to trap victims online - from fake investment opportunities to online stores - and the internet allows them to operate from any part of the world with anonymity. The ability to spot online scams is an important skill to have as the virtual world is increasingly becoming a part of every facet of our lives. The below tips will help you identify the signs which can indicate that a website could be a scam.

thought: The Scamadviser review indicates several red flags: the owner of the website is using a service to hide their identity, the site has a low Tranco rank (implying low traffic), and the website is very young. These are common characteristics of scam websites. While there is a valid SSL certificate, this alone does not guarantee legitimacy, as scammers can also use free SSL certificates. There are no consumer reviews, which means there's limited feedback on user experience. Given the information from Scamadviser, combined with the unusually low prices observed on the website, there is enough evidence to suspect it may be a scam. I now know the final answer. The URL https://www.angebotedesport.com/ is likely a scam website.

observation.reason: The website has unusually low prices the owner's identity is hidden it has a low traffic rank and the domain is very new. Although there's a valid SSL certificate this does not conclusively prove the site's legitimacy especially when combined with the other red flags.
